Open topic with navigation

OBD Window

Start Page

Ribbon: Diagnostics & XCP Tab|OBD

The OBD Window makes it possible to execute an On-Board Diagnostics (OBD) according to the SAE J1979 standard.

After the OBD Window was opened, a request is sent to all ECUs that will answer with the corresponding responses when they are supported. This so called Network scan must be started manually by the button . Based on the responses the module calculates all available ECUs and the requests supported by them.

With the respective icons in the toolbar the following commands are available when the window is activated:

Run network scan

Display/Close Trace area

Clear Trace area

Create OBD report

—

Activate all supported entries

Activate all entries

Deactivate all entries

Properties

System Status Register

Here all OBD capable ECUs are listed that have been identified during the network scan. In addition the supported diagnostic systems are displayed.

In the right upper area the MIL state (MIL = Malfunction Indicator Lamp) is displayed, as it is detected by the OBD Window. Underneath the number of the detected entries in the fault memory is given.

With the button Update system status the supported requests are sent to the detected OBD capable ECUs and the status of the monitored systems as well as the MIL status are displayed.

In the lower area, the Trace area status messages are displayed. This are can be deleted with the button or hidden with the button .

Live Data Grid

Here the parameters with the associated ECUs are displayed, e. g. the exact vehicle speed, the rotational frequency or the current pedal status.

With the button Update live data grid the respective requests are sent again and the responses are displayed. The requests can be sent also cyclic (button ), the cycle time is set in the Properties dialog. Single parameters can be deactivated and so excluded from the update. Deactivated parameters does not display values.

Vehicle Info

Here the vehicle data are displayed (e.g. the identification number – VIN) when they are supported by the ECU's in the vehicle).

In addition the single test counters In-use Performance Tracking are displayed when this information type is supported by the ECU, otherwise the list remains empty. The ECUs count the number of OBD test cycles. The numbers are displayed in hexadecimal format.

With the button Update vehicle info the respective requests are sent again and the parameters are displayed. Single vehicle data can be excluded from the update, too.

On-Board Test Results

Here the test results of OBD controlled components and systems are displayed that are not controlled continuously. These parameters can be also updated by the button Update on-board test results . In case of test results from lambda sensor you can show a legend via the button .
